intro: Hedyotis virgata, commonly known as the golden star or small-flowered bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Hedyotis virgata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
